newsitem.title: USA: Virginia prepares to execute killer.
newsitem.headline: Virginia prepares to execute killer.

text.p: Virginia prepared Tuesday to execute Larry Allen Stout, who killed a mother of two by stabbing her in the neck during a robbery.
Stout, 33, admitted killing Jacqueline Kooshian, owner and operator of Trimble's Cleaners in Staunton Feb. 17, 1987.
He was scheduled to be die by injection at 9 p.m. EST.
Stout spent his last day visiting with lawyers and ministers. He ordered sausage pizza, french fries and cherry pie for his last meal.
The Supreme Court turned down his last appeal Tuesday afternoon and Virginia Gov. George Allen announced later in the day that he would not intercede.
"One of the most fundamental human rights is the right to live one's life free from deadly criminal violence inflicted by others," Allen said in a statement.

The timing of the execution, on International Human Rights Day, sparked a protest at the state Capitol in Richmond Tuesday afternoon. Another was planned Tuesday night outside the Greensville Correctional Centre, where the execution was to take place.
Stout was to be the sixth person executedin Virginia this year.
